key_insight: HiStream makes high-resolution video generation practical by eliminating redundant computation across space, time, and sampling, using a streaming autoregressive pipeline that denoises cheaply and refines selectively.
problem_solved: Diffusion-based high-resolution video generation is infeasible in practice due to quadratic compute and memory costs; HiStream addresses this by reducing redundant work so inference becomes efficient and scalable.
method: Spatial compression: perform denoising at lower resolution then refine to high resolution using cached high‑level features to avoid re-computing shared spatial detail.
Temporal compression: generate video in streaming chunks with overlap and temporal feature caching so adjacent frames reuse computation rather than reprocessing entire sequences.
Sampling/computation compression: concentrate expensive high‑res denoising only where needed and reuse denoising trajectories or intermediate features to cut the number of heavy diffusion operations.
impact: Enables faster, lower‑cost high‑resolution video synthesis on practical hardware and makes large-scale or real‑time applications of diffusion-based video models more attainable for ML practitioners.

paper_title: HiStream: Efficient High-Resolution Video Generation via Redundancy-Eliminated Streaming
paper_authors: Haonan Qiu, Shikun Liu, Zijian Zhou, Zhaochong An, Weiming Ren
